channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: BNP: Scrap Hasina government's pact with India
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) demanded the cancellation of agreements signed with India over the last 15 years under Sheikh Hasina's administration, labeling them as 'secret' and 'unjust'. BNP's Ruhul Kabir Rizvi called for the interim government to revoke these deals, claiming they compromised Bangladesh's independence and sovereignty. The stance conflicts with foreign affairs adviser Md Touhid Hossain's position.

item.title: 'Strong enemies, opponents': China shifts military focus amid mounting challenges
item.description: China's military, directed by President Xi Jinping, shifted focus to prepare for conflicts against powerful adversaries. Emphasizing national sovereignty and security, Xi called for enhancing the strategic ability of the People’s Liberation Army (PLA). Defense official Miao Hua supported this shift amidst geopolitical tensions and rising threats, emphasizing the importance of military readiness and strategic clarity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Starliner to return empty, SpaceX to fly back the crew
item.description: NASA chose SpaceX to return U.S. astronauts from the ISS after Boeing faced major technical issues with its capsule. Boeing's Starliner will now return uncrewed. NASA administrator Bill Nelson emphasized safety, recalling past shuttle losses. Despite this setback, Nelson remains confident in future crewed Starliner missions.

item.title: What we know about the knife attack in Germany that killed 3
Israeli airstrikes kill dozens in Gaza ahead of ceasefire talks
item.description: Several Israeli airstrikes in southern Gaza resulted in the deaths of at least three dozen Palestinians, including 11 members of a family. The strikes targeted areas in Khan Younis and Rafah. Discussions on a potential ceasefire involving officials from the US, Egypt, and Qatar were underway in Cairo, with talks set to continue on Sunday.

item.title: Bangladesh's worst floods in decades leave 5 million stranded
item.description: Five million people in Bangladesh were stranded by severe floods in low-lying areas, with the death toll rising to 15. Strong currents washed away river embankments as five rivers faced the worst flooding since 2018. Eleven districts were affected, complicating rescue efforts significantly. The government rushed food and emergency supplies, opening 3,176 shelters.

item.title: France hunts for terror suspect after arson attack on synagogue injures cop
BNP seeks clear roadmap on polls
Kerry Kennedy reacts to RFK Jr's shocking endorsement: 'Disgusted by my brother's embrace of Donald Trump'
item.description: Kerry Kennedy expressed her deep disappointment at her brother Robert F Kennedy Jr's endorsement of Donald Trump, criticizing Trump's attributes and decisions. RFK Jr, having suspended his presidential campaign, endorsed Trump citing health and environmental concerns. The endorsement faced strong opposition from Kennedy's family, describing it as a betrayal and questioning his motives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's hit video game 'Wukong' sells 10 million copies in 3 days
item.description: Black Myth: Wukong, developed by Game Science and backed by Tencent, sold 10 million copies in its first 83 hours, becoming one of the fastest debuts ever. This action-adventure game based on the mythology of the Monkey King became the most popular single-player title on Steam. It generated over $450 million in revenue within three days.

item.title: Scramble for critical minerals spurs revival of African rail infrastructure
item.description: Southern Africa's railways have drawn global attention and billions in investments to secure copper supplies crucial for the energy transition. Governments, from Angola to Tanzania, are reviving old rail lines and building new ones. Increased demand from the central African copperbelt has highlighted the need for efficient export routes, notably between Zambia, Congo, and international markets.

item.title: 'Bees starving' in dismal year for French honey
item.description: French beekeepers reported a catastrophic year for honey production due to adverse weather conditions. Mickael Isambert, a beekeeper in central France, faced an 80% drop in honey yield, having to feed his bees with sugar. Low temperatures and heavy rainfall limited bees' ability to collect pollen and nectar, leading to colony starvation and significant losses nationwide.

item.title: Zelenskyy vows more 'retribution' for Russia as POWs exchanged
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy vowed intensified action against Russia on Ukrainian Independence Day. Kyiv and Moscow exchanged 230 prisoners, facilitated by the UAE. Zelensky signed a law banning the Russian-linked Ukrainian Orthodox Church. Meanwhile, tensions rise as Ukraine advances into Kursk and Russia targets Kostyantynivka in the ongoing conflict.

item.title: Elon Musk weighs in on Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrest: 'It’s 2030 in Europe and ...'
item.description: Pavel Durov, founder and CEO of Telegram, was arrested at Le Bourget Airport near Paris for allegedly failing to moderate content on Telegram, allowing criminal activities. Elon Musk reacted by highlighting free speech issues on his social media platform, X. Durov, who resides in Dubai, is a dual citizen of France and the UAE.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Pavel Durov and what led to Telegram founder's arrest?
item.description: Pavel Durov, Telegram's founder, was detained at Le Bourget Airport, France. The arrest is linked to allegations regarding the app's inadequate content moderation leading to criminal activities. French authorities have remained silent on the matter, while Russia seeks to clarify the circumstances. Telegram hasn't issued a statement, keeping Durov's future and Telegram’s policies in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rare virus with 30% mortality detected in Hudson Valley; four US towns implement voluntary lockdown
item.description: A rare equine virus, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), detected in several Hudson Valley counties and surrounding states, posed a 30% human mortality rate. An elderly man in Massachusetts and a horse in New York have been infected. Massachusetts towns implemented a voluntary evening lockdown to curb mosquito-borne threats, urging residents to stay indoors after peak mosquito hours.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Brace for tough times ahead': UK PM Keir Starmer prepares nation for a difficult road to recovery
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, in an upcoming speech, will address the nation's deep-seated issues. He admitted the road to recovery would be long, emphasizing the broken state inherited from the previous government. Starmer pointed to recent anti-migrant riots as evidence, vowing transparency and tough decisions to rectify the systemic rot.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov arrested in France: Reports
item.description: Pavel Durov, Telegram’s CEO, was detained at Paris’s Bourget airport due to an arrest warrant tied to a police investigation on content moderation issues. He was apprehended while traveling from Azerbaijan. Durov, who holds a fortune of $15.5 billion, founded Telegram after leaving Russia in 2014 to resist government demands.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At 34, Donald Trump had dismissed the idea of becoming President. Now he is seeking second term in office
item.description: At 34, Donald Trump had dismissed the idea of becoming President, noting the harshness of political life. He emphasized the lack of capable leaders in politics, stating that executives often avoided political office. Ironically, Trump later became the 45th President and is now preparing for his second term against Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk’s post declaring Trump 'too old' for presidency resurfaces after endorsement
item.description: After Elon Musk endorsed Donald Trump for the upcoming US Presidential elections, old tweets criticizing Trump resurfaced. Previously, Musk had suggested Trump should retire and supported Ron DeSantis against Biden. Now, Trump has praised Musk, hinting at a potential role in his administration if re-elected, marking a shift in their dynamic.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
